required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bilateral Dispensing Study of Fanfilcon A Toric Versus Enfilcon A Toric Lenses
clinical_study.official_title: Bilateral Dispensing Study of Fanfilcon A Toric Versus Enfilcon A Toric Lenses

brief_summary.textblock: Bilateral dispensing clinical trial of fanfilcon A toric lens verses enfilcon A toric lens over two weeks.

detailed_description.textblock: Evaluation of the clinical performance of an investigational silicone-hydrogel lens called fanfilcon A (test) compared to a FDA-cleared commercially available contact lens called enfilcon A toric lens (control) when worn on a daily wear basis over 2 weeks in a randomized, bilateral, cross-over, dispensing study.

primary_outcome.description: Participant rating for comfort at dispense visit and at the 2 week follow-up on a subjective rating scale (0-100, 0=cannot be worn. Causes pain,100=Cannot be felt ever)
Subjective assessment for comfort preference for each lens pair. Choices: fanfilcon A lens, enfilcon A lens, No preference.

arm_group.description: Each subject randomized to wear either the test or control as a matched pair and cross over to the second matched pair.
Each subject randomized to wear either the test or control as a matched pair and cross over to the second matched pair.

overall_official.affiliation: Clinical Research Center, University of California, Berkeley
Center for Contact Lens Research, University of Waterloo

facility.name: Clinical Research Center, University of California, Berkeley
Center for Contact Lens Research, University of Waterloo

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 44 subjects were enrolled (assigned an ID per protocol), but 11 were not assigned to any group due to screen failure.

group.title: Randomized for Fanfilcon A Lens First, Then Enfilcon A Lens
group.description: Each subject randomized to wear either the test or control as a matched pair and cross over to the second matched pair. fanfilcon A: toric contact lens enfilcon A: toric contact lens

group.title: Randomized for Enfilcon A Lens First, Then Fanfilcon A Lens
group.description: Each subject randomized to wear either the test or control as a matched pair and cross over to the second matched pair. fanfilcon A: toric contact lens enfilcon A: toric contact lens

baseline.population: Includes the 11 participants who were considered enrolled, but were screen failures and not randomly assigned to a particular arm.

group.title: Overall Study
group.description: All subjects were wore both fanfilcon A and enfilcon A toric lenses as either the first or second intervention.

outcome.title: Comfort (Subjective Rating Scale)
outcome.description: Participant rating for comfort at dispense visit and at the 2 week follow-up on a subjective rating scale (0-100, 0=cannot be worn. Causes pain,100=Cannot be felt ever)
outcome.population: Analysis population differs slightly due to 1 participant who was excluded from analysis due to a protocol deviation.

group.title: Fanfilcon A
group.description: All participants who wore fanfilcon A lens pair randomly assigned as first or second pair. fanfilcon A: contact lens

group.title: Enfilcon A
group.description: All participants who wore enfilcon A lens pair randomly assigned as first or second pair. enfilcon A: contact lens

measure.title: Comfort (Subjective Rating Scale)
measure.description: Participant rating for comfort at dispense visit and at the 2 week follow-up on a subjective rating scale (0-100, 0=cannot be worn. Causes pain,100=Cannot be felt ever)
measure.population: Analysis population differs slightly due to 1 participant who was excluded from analysis due to a protocol deviation.

outcome.title: Comfort Preference
outcome.description: Subjective assessment for comfort preference for each lens pair. Choices: fanfilcon A lens, enfilcon A lens, No preference.
outcome.population: Analysis population differs slightly due to protocol deviation.

group.title: Overall Study - Dispense
group.description: Each subject randomized to wear either the test or control as a matched pair and cross over to the second matched pair. fanfilcon A: contact lens enfilcon A: contact lens

group.title: Overall Study - Follow Up
group.description: Each subject randomized to wear either the test or control as a matched pair and cross over to the second matched pair. fanfilcon A: contact lens enfilcon A: contact lens

measure.title: Comfort Preference
measure.description: Subjective assessment for comfort preference for each lens pair. Choices: fanfilcon A lens, enfilcon A lens, No preference.
measure.population: Analysis population differs slightly due to protocol deviation.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data were collected through the duration of the study (2 weeks for each lens).
reported_events.desc: Adverse events data was collected during the follow-up visits and until the subject exited the study.

group.title: Fanfilcon A
group.description: Participants randomized to wear fanfilcon A either as the first or second lens during the cross over study.

group.title: Enfilcon A
group.description: Participants randomized to wear enfilcon A either as the first or second lens during the cross over study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor should be notified of any results communications and has ability to review.
